result.execSummary:
The defendant Tanisha L. Reyes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tanisha L. Reyes is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tanisha L. Reyes was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Tanisha L. Reyes
Current: 209 E. Park Street, Lower #4, Rhinelander, WI 54501 United States  (Effective: 05-27-2016)
Prior: 404 Pelham Street, Rhinelander, WI 54501

2:05 p.m. Defendant Tanisha L. Reyes in court, in custody, with attorney Brian F. Bennett. Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16CM120, 16CF92, 15CF169. Schiek speaks to agreement/resolution. No agreement in 16CM120, jury trial requested. In 16CF92 State moves to dismiss Cts. 1 and 4; deferred entry to Ct. 3. Court grants motion to dismiss. Defendant pleads no contest to Cts. 2 & 3. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 2. Court defers entry of judgment on Ct. 3. Schiek/Bennett statement to sentencing on 16CF92 & 15CF169. Bennett files defendant's sentencing letter to the court. Court statement. $1,500 cash bond reduced to $1,500 signature bond. Review on DEJ scheduled for 5/17/17 at 3:30 p.m. 16CM120 scheduled for jury on 8/5/16 at 8:30 a.m. 

Court sentence - 16CF92/Ct. 2
Court Costs/DNA surcharge
DNA sample
Appeal Rights

Court sentence 15CF169/Ct. 3
60 days' county jail
55 days' credit/time served
Costs to civil judgment
Appeal Rights
includes revocation summary and cover letter

2:18 p.m. Defendant Tanisha L. Reyes in court with attorney Corey Mehlos. Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm78, 15cm238, 15cm415, 15cm169, 15tr1126, 15tr1125, 15tr1124. State moves to dismiss 15tr1124, 15tr1125 and 15tr1126- Granted. State moves to dismiss Count 1 in 15CM78 - Granted. State moves to dismiss 15cm415 - Granted. State moves to dismiss Counts 1, 2, 4 and 5 in 15cf169-Granted. State moves to dismiss Count 2 in 15cm238 - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea to remaining Counts. Plea questionaire filed.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig states victim rights complied with. Michlig/Mehlos/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court sentence
In 15cm238
Jail - 30 days
Jail credit - 29 days
WHS/POP 2 years concurrent
Supervision Fees
FIne - $300 plus costs totalling $762.00
Blood Draw Surcharge
Driver's License revocation- 1 year
IID - 12 months
Driver's Safety Plan
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

In all other cases
WHS/POP 2 years concurrent
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
AODA Assessment
Comply with aftercare treatment from Koinonia
Continue counseling for anger management until successful discharge by provider
No intoxicants
No taverns except for purposes of employment
Employment to be approved by PO
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Jail credit if revoked - by stipulation of parties within 10 days or credit will be zero
Appeal rights given
Adj. 2:44 p.m.
No intoxicants no taverns. Contact is allowed with Mr. Fleming. Bond is in Case No. 15CF169, 15CM78, 15CM 238, 15TR1124, 15TR1125, 15TR1126

2:06 p.m. Defendant Tanisha L. Reyes in court with attorney Corey Mehlos.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf169, 15cm78, 15tr1124, 15tr1125, 15cm238 and 15tr1126. Schiek statement to status. Schiek requests modifications to bonds. Mehlos statement - treatment at Koinonia has been completed. Fleming statement to no contact provision on bond. Court modifies bonds to lift no contact provision with Fleming - Sets $2000 sig bond in all cases. Schiek statement believes agreement has been reached - requests sentencing hearing date. Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 02:00 pm. Adj. 2:12 p.m.

03:24 pm - Defendant Tanisha L. Reyes in court, via video, in custody. Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cf169 and 15cm78 and 15cm238, 15tr1124-26.  Voorhees appears for limited purposes.  JT scheduled 8/6/15 in case 15cm78.  Court adjourns until August 6th.  Defendant states there is a waiting list for Koinonia.  Defendant request to modify bond.  Court denies motion to modify bond.  Court directs jail to allow defendant to contact Koinonia directly as to getting on waiting list.  Bail continued.  Adjourned 03:30 p.m.
No contact w/Robert J. Fremming - If unable to post cash may attend inpatient treatment at Koinonia.  No intoxicants, no taverns.

02:01 pm - Defendant Tanisha L. Reyes in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
